refnamediv.refpurpose: Adjusts the result pointer to an arbitary row in the result

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The mysqli_data_seek function seeks to an arbitrary result pointer specified by the offset in the result set represented by result. The offset parameter must be between zero and the total number of rows minus one (0..mysqli_num_rows - 1).

note.para: This function can only be used with unbuffered results attained from the use of the mysqli_store_result or mysqli_query functions.

example.title: Object oriented style
example.programlisting:
<?php
/* Open a connection */
$mysqli = new mysqli("localhost", "my_user", "my_password", "test");

$mysqli->query( "DROP TABLE IF EXISTS friends");
$mysqli->query( "CREATE TABLE friends (id int, name varchar(30))");

$mysqli->query( "INSERT INTO friends VALUES (1, 'Greant'),
  (2, 'Stocker'), (3, 'Rethans'), (4, 'Wendel')");

example.title: Object oriented style
example.programlisting:
<?php
/* Open a connection */
$link = mysqli_connect("localhost", "my_user", "my_password", "test");

mysqli_query($link, "DROP TABLE IF EXISTS friends");
mysqli_query($link, "CREATE TABLE friends (id int, name varchar(30))");

mysqli_query($link, "INSERT INTO friends VALUES (1, 'Greant'),
 (2, 'Stocker'), (3, 'Rethans'), (4, 'Wendel')");
                                                                                                               
/* Get some rows */
$query = "SELECT name FROM friends ORDER BY name";
$result = mysqli_query($link, $query) or die(mysqli_error($link));

$total = mysqli_num_fields($result);

if ($total > 0) { /* there is at least one row */
    /* Get the last employee */
    mysqli_data_seek($result, mysqli_num_rows($result) -1);
    $friend = mysqli_fetch_row($result);
    printf ("Friends name : %s\n", $friend[0]);
}
        
mysqli_free_result($result);
mysqli_close($link);
?>
